subject: Business
title: Survivorship Bias: The Silent Failures
description: A quick win: understand Survivorship Bias: The Silent Failures.

hook.text: In WWII, engineers studied bullet holes on returning planes. Abraham Wald said: armor the places with no holes.

buildup.text: Survivorship bias means we study successes and ignore the failures we never see.

discovery.text: The planes with holes in those other spots never came back. The data was missing, not absent.

twist.text: Business books study successful founders, ignoring thousands who did the same things and failed.

climax.text: Steve Jobs dropped out of college and succeeded. Millions dropped out and you'll never hear of them.

punchline.text: Don't copy survivors. Study what killed everyone else.
